org.ingatan.io
Class IOManager

java.lang.Object
  org.ingatan.io.IOManager

public abstract class IOManager
extends java.lang.Object

Manages IO operations, and takes care of removing all temporary directories as they are no longer needed. This class hinges on all other classes reporting to it when the resource is no longer needed. For example, the Library Manager must report that it no longer requires a particular library to be open, and so the library's temporary directory may then be deleted provided no other component requires it.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham

Field Detail

MAX_IMAGE_ID_LENGTH

public static final int MAX_IMAGE_ID_LENGTH
Any method that generates an image ID should respect this value for maximum length.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

groups

protected static Group[] groups
All groups files, as loaded upon initiation

libraryIDs

protected static java.lang.String[] libraryIDs
List of library IDs, as loaded from the groups file. When a new library is created, or an old library is deleted, this array is updated. The ID is also the filename of the library. When the groups file is resaved, the values for the 'all libraries' field come directly from this array.

libraryNames

protected static java.lang.String[] libraryNames
The names of the libraries as they correspond to memembers of the libraryIDs array.

libraries

protected static Library[] libraries
Library objects representing libraries that have been loaded. Not all libraries are loaded at once. The libraries in this array have been loaded, and will be unloaded once the IOManager detects that they are no longer in use anywhere.

answerFieldsFile

protected static AnswerFieldsFile answerFieldsFile
The AnswerFieldsFile contains all default and plug-in answer field classes in a hashtable. The classes are accessible by using their class name. Default values for all answer fields are also included in a hashmap. These are generated and read by each answer field, and set by the user.

quizHistoryFile

protected static QuizHistoryFile quizHistoryFile
File that contains the total overall score acheived so far, as well as records of all quizes that have been undertaken (dates, results, questions asked/skipped, and libraries used). The user can delete specific entries, so may not be complete.

beenInitialised

protected static boolean beenInitialised
This flag is set so that the manager cannot be initialised twice.

userHomePath

protected static java.lang.String userHomePath
This is the home path for this user, as reported by System.getProperty("user.home"). This can be problematic on some systems, and so it is possible to set a custom path for

customHomePath

protected static java.lang.String customHomePath
This is set when the user uses the --homeDir=[directory] option to load ingatan. If this string is not empty, then the userHomePath obtained from System.getProperty("user.home") will be overwritten with this value.

ansFieldClassLoader

protected static java.net.URLClassLoader ansFieldClassLoader
URLClassLoader which is instantiated with the user's home directory as a classpath. The answer field plug-in classes are located here, and this provides a means by which to load them.

random

public static java.util.Random random
Instance of the Random class that is seeded with the current time in milliseconds when the IOManager is instantiated.

windowIcon

public static java.awt.Image windowIcon
Ingatan's icon sized for windows/frames.

IOManager

public IOManager()
Method Detail

initiateIOManager

public static void initiateIOManager()
Initiates the IOManager. Loads all group files, and a list of all library files. If the IOManager has already been initialised and this method is called, then no action is taken.

Returns:
the reset ImageAcquisitionDialog.

getSelectionIcon

public static java.awt.Image getSelectionIcon()
Gets an image for the indication that a selector tab is selected. It is a preference as to whether a circle dot should be used, or playful icons of Michael. The appropriate icon is returned depending on this setting.

Returns:
an image for the indication that a selector tab is selected.

Returns:
if the library manager has ever been loaded before for this installation.

setUseMichaelAsSelectionIndicator

public static void setUseMichaelAsSelectionIndicator(boolean useMichael)
Whether or not mini Michael icons should be used in QuestionList to indicate selection. If not, a small blue ball is used.

Parameters:
useMichael - true if Michael should be used to indicate selection.

isUsingMichaelAsSelectionIndicator

public static boolean isUsingMichaelAsSelectionIndicator()
Checks whether or not mini Michael icons are being used in QuestionList to indicate selection. If not, a small blue ball is being used.

addDefaultAnswerFieldsToTables

public static void addDefaultAnswerFieldsToTables(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class> classTable,
                                                  java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> defaultsTable)
Adds all "hard coded" default answer fields to the provided class and defaults HashTables. This is the central location for the listing of default answer fields. Adds empty defaults to the defaults table.

Parameters:
classTable - the Hashtable with String keys and Class objects to which the default answer fields should be added.
defaultsTable - the Hashtable with String keys and String objects to which the default answer fields should be added.

getSymbolMenuCharacterMap

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSymbolMenuCharacterMap()
Gets the symbol menu character map. This contains the symbol lists that correspond to a particular symbol menu generator. For example, if the user presses Ctrl+space to initiate the menu, and then the 'a' key to generate the menu, a is used as the key in this map to retreive the list of symbols that should be shown.

Returns:
the symbol menu character map.

defaultSymbolMenuCharacterMap

public static void defaultSymbolMenuCharacterMap()
Reset the symbol menu character map to the default values. This writes the default values to the symbol menu file, and sets the IOManager symbol menu character map variable.

getQuizHistoryFile

public static QuizHistoryFile getQuizHistoryFile()
Gets the quiz history file initialised/parsed at IOManager initialisation. May have been mutated since then.

Returns:
the quiz history file.

cleanUpAndRepackage

public static void cleanUpAndRepackage()
                                throws java.io.IOException
Cleans up the ingatan directory, repacks any open libraries and deletes the temporary library directory. Also rewrites the groups file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getGroupsThatContain

Parameters:

Returns:
String array of all groups that contain the library with the specified ID.

writeGroupsFile

public static void writeGroupsFile()
Writes the groups file encapsulated by IOManager to file. This simply calls

ParserWriter.writeGroupsFile(groups);
where groups is a private variable, the Group[] array.

Returns:
the path of the directory where the library files are saved.

getPreferencesFile

public static java.lang.String getPreferencesFile()
Gets the path for the preferences file (absolute). This file contains general preferences and describes the map of symbol menu characters to initiator characters. That is, the symbols that are shown in the symbol menu for each different key that can be pressed after pressing Ctrl+space.

Returns:
the path for the path for the symbol menu file (absolute).

importLibrary

public static void importLibrary(java.io.File libraryToImport,
                                 java.lang.String groupName)
                          throws java.io.IOException

deleteLibrary

editLibrary

public static void editLibrary(java.lang.String libID,
                               java.lang.String newName,
                               java.lang.String newDescription,
                               boolean resetCorrectness)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Edits the name and description values of the specified library, and provides the option to reset the statistics for all questions contained by the library. If no change is desired to either/both name and description fields, then these parameters can be null. If the specified library is not found, then no change will be made.

Parameters:
libID - the ID of the library that should be edited.
newName - the new name for this library, or null if no change is desired.
newDescription - the new description for this library, or null if no change is desired.
resetCorrectness - true if all statistics should be cleared for all questions contained by this library.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong while packaging the library

the specified array with the element at index removed.

Returns:

generateLibraryID

public static java.lang.String generateLibraryID(java.lang.String base)
Keeps altering the base until it is unique. Will not return a string of greater length than 15.

Parameters:
base - usually the library name.
Returns:
a unique library ID equal to or less than 15 characters in length.

getUserHomePath

public static java.lang.String getUserHomePath()
Gets the path from which this jar is executing. Does not include a trailing '/', so this will need to be added.

Returns:
the path from which this jar is executing.

getLibraryName

public static java.lang.String getLibraryName(java.lang.String libraryID)
Gets the name of the library with ID libraryID.

Parameters:
libraryID - the ID of the library whose name will be returned
Returns:
the name of the library with the specified ID or "" if the library can't be found.

loadLibrary

public static Library loadLibrary(java.lang.String libraryID)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Checks whether or not the library is already loaded, and if not, loads the library. Returns the library. If the library is already loaded, then this is equivalent to the getLibraryFromID method.

Returns:
the library that has been loaded.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getLibraryFromID

public static Library getLibraryFromID(java.lang.String libraryID)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Gets the library from the ID if the library is currently loaded, loads the library first if needed.

Parameters:
libraryID -
Returns:
the library corresponding to this library ID, or null if the library cannot be loaded for some reason.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem loading this library (if it was not already loaded)

isLibraryLoaded

getGroup

public static Group getGroup(java.lang.String groupName)
Attempts to return the group with the specified group name, if the group cannot be found, method returns null.

Parameters:
groupName - the name of the group that should be returned
Returns:
the group with the specified name, or null if that group cannot be found.

getAnswerFieldClass

public static java.lang.Class getAnswerFieldClass(java.lang.String classID)
Gets the answer field class associated with the specified classID.

Parameters:
classID - the class ID of the answer field that is required.
Returns:
the answer field class associated with the specified classID, or null if the answer field cannot be found.

getAnswerFieldDefault

public static java.lang.String getAnswerFieldDefault(java.lang.String classID)
Gets the default value text for the answer field class associated with the specified classID. This text is interpretted entirely by the particular answer field implementation it is passed to.

Parameters:
classID - the class ID of the answer field for which the defaults text is required.
Returns:
the default value text for the answer field class associated with the specified class ID.

getAnswerFieldClassIDs

public static java.util.Enumeration getAnswerFieldClassIDs()
Gets an enumeration of all classIDs for answer fields.

Returns:
enumeration of all classIDs of answer fields.

getAnswerFieldsFile

public static AnswerFieldsFile getAnswerFieldsFile()
Get the object encapsulating data held in the Answer Fields file. This object contains a list of all added answer fields and their defaults.

Returns:
the answer fields file.

Gets a list of all library names.

Returns:
an array of all library names.

Gets a list of all library IDs.

an array of all library IDs.

getGroupList

public static java.lang.String[] getGroupList()
A list of all the names of groups that have been created.

Returns:
an array of all the names of groups that have been created.

getGroupListWithNoneOption

public static java.lang.String[] getGroupListWithNoneOption()
Convenience method for getting the group list with a 'None' entry at the beginning. This can be used where the user is prompted to select a group, but may also select 'None'. Equivalent to adding a \"None\" element to the beginning of the array resulting from getGroupList().

Returns:
the list of all group names with an additional element called 'None' at index 0.

saveImage

public static java.lang.String saveImage(java.lang.String libID,
                                         java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                         java.lang.String imageID)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Saves a BufferedImage to the specified library, with the specified imageID. If the imageID is not unique within the specified library, then it will be altered by appending a number to the end. Any imageID of more than MAX_IMAGE_ID_LENGTH characters will be shortened to MAX_IMAGE_ID_LENGTH characters.

Parameters:
libID - the library to which the image should be saved
image - the image to save
imageID - the imageID to use. This is altered if not unique for the specified library. Also, this may be left blank ("") if an imageID should be automatically generated.
Returns:
String the unique imageID that this image has been assigned. This may be different to the specified ID value, as the specified value may not have been unique. Returns an empty string if the operation was unsuccessful.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the image.

saveImage

public static java.lang.String saveImage(java.lang.String libID,
                                         java.lang.String imageFileName)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Saves the specified file as an image to the specified library. A unique imageID of no more than 15 characters is automatically generated from the given image filename. This method loads the specified image and calls saveImage(Library, BufferedImage,String).

Parameters:
libID - the library to which this image should be saved.
imageFileName - the image to save to the specified library.
Returns:
String the unique imageID that this image has been assigned. Returns an empty String if the operation has been unsuccessful.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the image.

saveImageWithOverWrite

public static void saveImageWithOverWrite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                          java.lang.String libID,
                                          java.lang.String imageID)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Saves the image with the specified ID to the specified library without ensuring that the ID is unique within that library. This means that if any resource exists with that ID, it will be overwritten. This method still ensures that the ID is no larger than MAX_IMAGE_ID_LENGTH.

Parameters:
img - the image to write.
libID - the ID of the library to which the image should be written.
imageID - the ID that the image should take.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

loadImage

public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage loadImage(java.lang.String libID,
                                                     java.lang.String imageID)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
Loads the image with the specified ID from the specified library.

Parameters:
libID - the library from which to load the image.
imageID - the ID of the image that should be loaded.
Returns:
the requested image from library lib with ID imageID.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem loading the image.

loadResource

public static java.io.FileInputStream loadResource(java.lang.String libID,
                                                   java.lang.String fileID)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
Loads the file with the specified ID from the specified library. This allows for non-image files to be saved and loaded. This opens the possibility for answer fields that use audio, for example. Note: has not been well tested.

Parameters:
libID - the library from which to load the file.
fileID - the ID of the file that should be loaded.
Returns:
the input stream for the requested file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem loading the file.

saveResource

public static java.lang.String saveResource(java.lang.String libID,
                                            java.lang.String filename)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Saves the specified file to the specified library. A unique fileID of no more than 15 characters is automatically generated from the given filename. This method copies the specified file to the specified library. Note: has only been marginally tested.

Parameters:
libID - the library to which this file should be saved.
filename - the file to save to the specified library.
Returns:
String the unique fileID that this file has been assigned. Returns an empty String if the operation has been unsuccessful.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the file.

copyResource

public static java.lang.String copyResource(java.lang.String sourceLibraryID,
                                            java.lang.String sourceID,
                                            java.lang.String destLibraryID)
Copies the specified resource to the specified destination library.

Parameters:
sourceLibraryID - The libraryID in which the resource currently exists.
sourceID - the ID of the resource as it exists within the source library.
destLibraryID - the ID of the library to which the resource should be copied.
Returns:
the new ID for the destination resource. This is likely to be the same as sourceID, unless sourceID was not unique in the destination library.

copyImage

public static java.lang.String copyImage(java.lang.String sourceLibraryID,
                                         java.lang.String sourceID,
                                         java.lang.String destLibraryID)
Copies the specified image to the specified destination library. This method is just included for consistency, and is actually the same as calling copyResource.

Parameters:
sourceLibraryID - The libraryID in which the image currently exists.
sourceID - the ID of the image as it exists within the source library.
destLibraryID - the ID of the library to which the image should be copied.
Returns:
the new ID for the destination image. This is likely to be the same as sourceID, unless sourceID was not unique in the destination library.

saveResourceWithOverWrite

public static void saveResourceWithOverWrite(java.lang.String filename,
                                             java.lang.String libID,
                                             java.lang.String fileID)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Saves the file with the specified ID to the specified library without ensuring that the ID is unique within that library. This means that if any resource exists with that ID, it will be overwritten. This method still ensures that the ID is no larger than MAX_IMAGE_ID_LENGTH. Note: has not been well tested.

Parameters:
filename - the file to write.
libID - the ID of the library to which the file should be written.
fileID - the ID that the file should take.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
